title: Error boundaries in renderToString: "TypeError: Cannot read property 'listeners' of null" in renderToString
body:
**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**

Report a Bug

**What is the current behavior?**

We're seeing errors in Kibana, across our userbase, when rendering in NodeJS:

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'listeners' of null
    at ReactDOMComponent.Mixin.unmountComponent ([PATH_OMITTED]/node_modules/react-dom/lib/ReactDOMComponent.js:960:43)
    at Object.ReactReconciler.unmountComponent ([PATH_OMITTED]/node_modules/react-dom/lib/ReactReconciler.js:79:22)
    at Object.ReactChildReconciler.unmountChildren ([PATH_OMITTED]/node_modules/react-dom/lib/ReactChildReconciler.js:146:25)
    at ReactDOMComponent.ReactMultiChild.Mixin.unmountChildren ([PATH_OMITTED]/node_modules/react-dom/lib/ReactMultiChild.js:373:28)
    at ReactDOMComponent.Mixin.unmountComponent ([PATH_OMITTED]/node_modules/react-dom/lib/ReactDOMComponent.js:980:10)
    at Object.ReactReconciler.unmountComponent ([PATH_OMITTED]/node_modules/react-dom/lib/ReactReconciler.js:79:22)
    at Object.ReactChildReconciler.unmountChildren ([PATH_OMITTED]/node_modules/react-dom/lib/ReactChildReconciler.js:146:25)
    at ReactDOMComponent.ReactMultiChild.Mixin.unmountChildren ([PATH_OMITTED]/node_modules/react-dom/lib/ReactMultiChild.js:373:28)
    at ReactDOMComponent.Mixin.unmountComponent ([PATH_OMITTED]/node_modules/react-dom/lib/ReactDOMComponent.js:980:10)
    at Object.ReactReconciler.unmountComponent ([PATH_OMITTED]/node_modules/react-dom/lib/ReactReconciler.js:79:22)
```

**If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem via https://jsfiddle.net or similar (template: https://jsfiddle.net/84v837e9/).**

Because this happens in React internals, and we haven't been able to reproduce the issue, I'm struggling to create a minimal repro. I've searched for this issue, but have only been able to find gaearon/react-hot-loader#466, which wasn't exactly helpful as we don't use React Hot Loader... Can someone maybe explain to me what type of behavior would cause this? Based on that I can dig a bit further.

**What is the expected behavior?**

No error.

**Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?**

**Packages**
React: 15.4.2
React-DOM: 15.4.2

*update*: could have coincided with 15.4.1 -> 15.4.2 upgrade.

**Server**
Node: 5.x
